title: 106_s2326
content: The Act titled "Wireless Eavesdropping Protection Act of 2000" aims to regulate commerce in electronic eavesdropping devices. The Act prohibits the modification of devices that would cause them to fail to comply with regulations and prohibits commerce in scanning receivers that do not have privacy protections. The Act prohibits the modification of scanning receivers to receive certain frequencies and requires them to have decoders for specific services. The Act prohibits unauthorized interception of encrypted radio transmissions and enhances privacy for users of shared frequencies. Regulations may be prescribed to prevent tampering with scanning receivers. The Act prohibits unauthorized interception of encrypted radio transmissions and enhances privacy for users of shared frequencies. Regulations may be prescribed to prevent tampering with scanning receivers, including warning labels on devices. The Federal Communications Commission must amend its regulations within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The Commission will amend its regulations to implement the amendments made by this section. SEC. 3. UNAUTHORIZED INTERCEPTION OR PUBLICATION OF COMMUNICATIONS. Section 705 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 605) is amended to include provisions regarding interception and divulging of communications. Section 705 of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions for interception and disclosure of communications, with specific changes made to subsections (5) and (6) regarding fines and violations. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to include provisions for interception and disclosure of communications. Changes are made to subsections (5) and (6) regarding fines and violations, including investigating and enforcing violations by the Commission.
